title: Second artical
body:
Requests for data from a different server (than the requesting page), are called cross-site HTTP requests. Cross-site requests are common on the web. Many pages load CSS, images, and scripts from different servers. In modern browsers, cross-site
HTTP requests from scripts are restricted to same site for security reasons. The following line, in our PHP examples, has been added to allow cross-site access.
author: Mike Smith
